The Tale of Devi Chandragupta

According to the play 'Devi Chandraguptam' by Vishakhadatta, Ramagupta was the elder son of Samudragupta who was a coward. He made a humiliating agreement to hand over his wife Dhruvadevi to a Shaka king.

тЪФя╕П
Chandragupta's Rebellion

Ramagupta's younger brother, Chandragupta II, disguised himself, killed the Shaka king, and later assassinated Ramagupta to ascend the throne and marry Dhruvadevi.

ЁЯУМ
Important Facts (Exam Points)
  • Archaeology: Copper coins of Ramagupta have been found in the Vidisha (Eran-Bhilasa) region, proving his historicity.
  • Durjanpur Inscription: Ramagupta's name as 'Maharajadhiraja' has been found on Jain idols.
